market_summary: Mega-cap AI complex remains headline-sensitive; recent stories cite pressure around AI investment/capex narratives impacting MSFT/AMZN sentiment (news items dated 2026-02-12 to 2026-02-13).
Gold exposure (GLD) shows near-term strength on the day (+0.96% to 456.54) and strong recent trend implied by the past ~3 months price series (GLD rallied sharply into late Jan before a pullback).
Crypto risk appetite appears weaker near-term: BTC-USD at 66,952 (-1.29% day), with a steep drawdown visible from early-Feb levels in the provided daily series.

thesis_damage_flags.why: Quality/momentum signal stress: price series shows a sharp early-Feb drawdown (e.g., 246.29 close on 2026-01-08 to 210.32 on 2026-02-06; 197.76 close on 2026-02-13), consistent with recent negative AI-investment narrative headlines (2026-02-12).
Momentum deterioration visible in price series (e.g., 503.29 close 2025-11-13 vs 401.73 close 2026-02-13) alongside negative AI-investment narrative headline coverage (2026-02-12).
High volatility and downside momentum: daily series shows large drop from ~78,666 (2026-02-02 close) to ~62,791 (2026-02-05 close) with partial rebound to ~66,954 (2026-02-13 close).

thesis: Quality + profitability profile remains exceptional in available metrics: gross margin 70.05%, operating margin 62.26%, net margin 53.01%, ROE 83.43% (key ratios snapshot).
Balance sheet/liquidity strength: current ratio 4.47, quick ratio 3.71, low debt-to-equity 0.09, very high interest coverage 471.7 (key ratios snapshot).
Growth still positive in snapshot metrics: revenue growth 13.27%, earnings growth 14.55%, EPS growth 15.02%, FCF growth 7.36% (key ratios snapshot).
risks: Valuation risk: P/E 45.77 and P/S 24.26 (key ratios snapshot) leave the stock vulnerable to multiple compression over a 30-day horizon.
Crowded AI trade / sentiment whipsaw: recent coverage highlights volatility and 'nearly unanimous' bullishness into late-Feb (news dated 2026-02-13), which can precede sharp reversals.
Execution/cycle risk: even small demand/capacity or competitive shifts can hit a high-expectations stock disproportionately (implied by high PEG 3.05 and low FCF yield 1.70%).
falsifiable_checks: If NVDA’s profitability profile deteriorates vs current snapshot (e.g., operating margin materially below ~62% in the next update), reduce weight.

If near-term price action breaks down versus the recent range visible in the series (e.g., fails to hold the early-Feb rebound zone after 171.88 close on 2026-02-05 and 190.04 close on 2026-02-09), treat as momentum failure and cut exposure.
trade_of_the_day.why_now: Over 6–18 months, AI compute demand and platform buildouts are a durable theme; NVDA shows verifiable combination of strong margins (OM ~62%), high returns (ROE ~83%), solid growth (rev ~13% YoY), and strong liquidity (current ratio ~4.5). Near-term (30 days), sizing is capped to manage valuation/sentiment risk while keeping exposure to the strongest quality+momentum evidence in this candidate set.

constraints_check.notes: 8 positions; weights sum to 100%. Max position 20% (<=40). Sector concentration: Information Technology totals 34% (MSFT 14 + NVDA 20), below 80%. Crypto exposure 8% (<=10%). Broad index ETFs excluded.
